definition: lit. to catch everything in the one net (idiom)/fig. to scoop up the whole lot/to capture them all in one go
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
net/network
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: And the sound DADA was very clear.
sentences.chinese: 和一网打尽的声音非常清楚。

sentences.english: At the present time, the internet is the single net that has captured the whole world.
sentences.chinese: 当今时代，一张互联网，将天下一网打尽。

sentences.english: Final Zhang Quanzhong hostage of one rescue of Shi Erdiao success peddles poison catch the whole lot in an action.
sentences.chinese: 最后张全忠一石二鸟成功解救人质并将毒贩一网打尽。

sentences.english: The gamblers were cleaned out by the policemen.
Ten animals I slam in a net.
sentences.chinese: 我把十只动物一网打尽。

sentences.english: We find them; we take them as a team and we bring them back.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到他们，把他们一网打尽，捉拿归案。

sentences.english: Was he attempting to prepare a wholesale massacre to avenge his son?
sentences.chinese: 莫非他企图把大伙都一网打尽来给他儿子报仇？

sentences.english: And cruising predators snatched up nearly all of them within 30 hours.
sentences.chinese: 巡游的觅食者在30小时内几乎将其一网打尽。

sentences.english: And he'll catch all the fish in the bayou.
sentences.chinese: 他会将河口里所有的鱼虾一网打尽。

sentences.english: But two cops hiding in the back came out with guns and caught them all.
sentences.chinese: 但是两名埋伏在后面的警察持枪出来把他们一网打尽。

sentences.english: The criminals were cleaned out by the policeman.
They are the ones who are running. And we will catch them all and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 逃窜的是他们，而我们将把他们一网打尽并绳之以法。

definition: see 連鍋端|连锅端 [lian2 guo1 duan1]
to apprehend/to capture/to seize
to bring to justice
to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
to gather (people)/to collect (talent)/to come to an end
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
to gather/to collect/to bring together
to take even the cooking pots (idiom)/to clean out/to wipe out
to seize/to capture
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to capture alive
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to eliminate (by armed force)
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
